comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: So who are the others ?  The guy in the middle looks familiar.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: This pic was taken a few weeks after the upper chords of the Harbour Bridge were joined...though it appears to have been taken at ground level. Frank Litchfield was a supervising engineer with the NSW Public Works Department Harbour Bridge staff. We can identify him via the crop from this pic which appears at ca. 3:20 in this fascinating vid - www.youtube.com/watch?v=JPQ7CzVHdMs ; Litchfield provided some of the commentary which accompanies the vid...evidently recorded in 1969 when he was aged 80. If other Bradfield family members are present they might perhaps be identified via this pic - www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/4689268321/in/set... Here's the alternative pic - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/search.as... I wonder whether the elderly gent with the side-levers might be Justice Alf Backhouse (1851-1939). There's a pic of him accompanying his ADB entry - adb.anu.edu.au/biography/backhouse-alfred-paxton-44 ...Backhouse appears in this other SRNSW pic, which was taken in March 1931 when the deck was under construction... investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/search.as... investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/search.as... If the captions are correct, this other SRNSW pic (dated 12/9/1930) includes two of Bradfield's sons (there were 5 Bradfield sons all up!...2 doctors, 1 engineer, 2 lawyers)...the chap on the far rhs is referred to as Dr Bradfield...the three candidates are Edward 'Ned' Ventris Bradfield (1893- ?) who graduated from the University of Sydney Medical School in 1918...Stanley George Bradfield (1906 - 1951), who graduated from the University of Sydney Medical School in 1930...or possibly even Keith 'Bill' Bradfield (1910-2006), who in 1930 was a Science undergrad at the University of Sydney...he later obtained a PhD...whoever they are, they look like the chap standing next to Frank Litchfield in the pic above...

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Per the SMH, a centre hanger was to be placed in position on the day this SRNSW pic was taken, however this was postponed due to the weather nla.gov.au/nla.news-article16717107

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: The woman/girl next to Edith Bradfield might be the Bradfields' daughter Mary, seen here investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/search.as... looks like she's wearing the same hat and coat...

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/8283751164/in/pho... same day...different place...here we get a better view of Mary Bradfield and also the elderly gent with side-levers who I suspect might be Alfred Backhouse.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=255676 - bit of a long shot...but just going on this SLNSW collection pic, which dates from 1966, I'd say there's a chance the young woman seated on the rhs is this woman...Mrs J.P.O. Backhouse (nee Brenda 'Dutchie' Somerville), who per NSW BDMs married one of Justice Backhouse's nephews in 1939... nla.gov.au/nla.news-article17581900 ...according to this SMH report on her wedding, her father was Colonel George Somerville adb.anu.edu.au/biography/somerville-george-cattell-8580 , who was for many years secretary of the Royal Agricultural Society...which means that her father would have known Sam Hordern well...see next comment...! here's a wonderful Woollahra Municipal Council bio of Brenda Somerville/Backhouse... www.woollahra.nsw.gov.au/library/local_history/women_in_w...

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: The chap in the middle wearing the bowler hat looks a bit like Sam Hordern... acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=7712 acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=7994 ; acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=51532 ...but I'm not yet quite convinced Sir Sam's ears and jowls match up with this chap's. For what it's worth, the digitised newspapers indicate that Backhouse and Hordern appear to have sometimes moved in the same social circles. They were both NSW Rowing Association committee members, etc. ... both appear to have been in Sydney or thereabouts at the time the pic was taken. Hordern was for many years president of the Royal Agricultural Society....the digitised newspapers also indicate that Alf Backhouse, Sam Hordern and George Somerville sometimes moved in the same social circles... strathfieldheritage.org/people/biographies/samuel-hordern/ this pic of Hordern is perhaps a better match... acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=36098 I gather he's the chap on the lhs in this pic Here's his ADB entry just for interest adb.anu.edu.au/biography/hordern-sir-samuel-506

comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content: There is a wharf pile just to the left of Dr Bradfield, so this photo would most probably have been taken at the wharf adjacent to the workshops at Milsons Point. Now Milsons Point wharf/Luna Park. It was from this wharf that most steel was delivered or moved out from the adjacent workshops and barged out to be hoisted.
